title: How to Make Porcini Parmesan

steps.headline: In one of the skillets, heat a drizzle of olive oil.
Add onion and garlic.
steps.description: Sauté until the onions are translucent.

steps.headline: Stir in parsley, salt, pepper, dried herbs and tomato sauce.
Meanwhile, prepare the mushrooms.
steps.description: Slice them into ⁄4 inch (0.6 cm) thick slices,  and remove the spongy bits (pores) under the more solid cap of the mushrooms.

steps.headline: Beat the egg and milk together in the small bowl.
steps.description: Pour the bread crumbs into the other small bowl. Set aside.

steps.headline: Heat oil in the second skillet.
Dip the mushroom pieces, one at a time, into the egg mixture then into the bread crumbs.
steps.description: Immediately place them into the hot skillet.

steps.headline: Fry the mushrooms on both sides.
steps.description: You can add more oil as needed, and they are done when they are golden brown.

steps.headline: In the 2 quart baking dish, form the casserole.
steps.description: Add sauce first, then mushrooms, then mozzarella, with a sprinkle of Parmesan between each. You can have as many layers as you like.

steps.headline: Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven, for 1 hour.
steps.description: Or, until the top is bubbly and the edges are golden brown.

text: In one of the skillets, heat a drizzle of olive oil. Medium high heat is best. Add onion and garlic. Sauté until the onions are translucent. Stir in parsley, salt, pepper, dried herbs and tomato sauce. Simmer for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare the mushrooms. Slice them into ⁄4 inch (0.6 cm) thick slices,  and remove the spongy bits (pores) under the more solid cap of the mushrooms. Beat the egg and milk together in the small bowl. Pour the bread crumbs into the other small bowl. Set aside. Heat oil in the second skillet. Again, use medium high heat. Dip the mushroom pieces, one at a time, into the egg mixture then into the bread crumbs. Immediately place them into the hot skillet. Fry the mushrooms on both sides. You can add more oil as needed, and they are done when they are golden brown. In the 2 quart baking dish, form the casserole. Add sauce first, then mushrooms, then mozzarella, with a sprinkle of Parmesan between each. You can have as many layers as you like. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven, for 1 hour. Or, until the top is bubbly and the edges are golden brown. Finished.
